member.name: T:Google.GData.Extensions.Reminder
member.summary: GData schema extension describing a reminder on an event.

remarks.para: You can represent a set of reminders where each has a (1) reminder period and (2) notification method. The method can be either "sms", "email", "alert", "none", "all".

The meaning of this set of reminders differs based on whether you are reading or writing feeds. When reading, the set of reminders returned on an event takes into account both defaults on a parent recurring event (when applicable) as well as the user's defaults on calendar. If there are no gd:reminders returned that means the event has absolutely no reminders. "none" or "all" will not apply in this case.

Writing is different because we have to be backwards-compatible (see *) with the old way of setting reminders. For easier analysis we describe all the behaviors defined in the table below. (Notice we only include cases for minutes, as the other cases specified in terms of days/hours/absoluteTime can be converted to this case.)
Notice method is case-sensitive: must be in lowercase!

item.term: *Override with no +n for user's selected methods
Set exactly one reminder on event at +n with given method

remarks.para: Hence, to override an event with a set of reminder time, method pairs, just specify them exactly. To clear an event of all overrides (and go back to inheriting the user's defaults), one can simply specify a single gd:reminder with no extra attributes. To have NO event reminders on an event, either set a single gd:reminder with negative reminder time, or simply update the event with a single gd:reminder method=none.

member.name: T:Google.GData.Extensions.Where
member.summary: A place (such as an event location) associated with the containing entity. The type of the association is determined by the rel attribute; the details of the location are contained in an embedded or linked-to Contact entry. A gd:where element is more general than a gd:geoPt element. The former identifies a place using a text description and/or a Contact entry, while the latter identifies a place using a specific geographic location. Properties Property Type Description @label? xs:string Specifies a user-readable label to distinguish this location from other locations. @rel? xs:string Specifies the relationship between the containing entity and the contained location. Possible values (see below) are defined by other elements. For example, gd:when defines http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#event. @valueString? xs:string A simple string value that can be used as a representation of this location. gd:entryLink? entryLink Entry representing location details. This entry should implement the Contact kind. rel values Value Description http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#event or not specified Place where the enclosing event takes place. http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#event.alternate A secondary location. For example, a remote site with a videoconference link to the main site. http://schemas.google.com/g/2005#event.parking A nearby parking lot.

member.name: T:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress
member.summary: Postal address split into components. It allows to store the address in locale independent format. The fields can be interpreted and used to generate formatted, locale dependent address. The following elements reperesent parts of the address: agent, house name, street, P.O. box, neighborhood, city, subregion, region, postal code, country. The subregion element is not used for postal addresses, it is provided for extended uses of addresses only. In order to store postal address in an unstructured form formatted address field is provided.

member.name: M:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor for StructuredPostalAddress

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Primary
member.summary: accessor method public string Primary

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Rel
member.summary: accessor method for the Rel Value. Note you can only set this or Label, not both

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Label
member.summary: accessor method for the Label value. Note you can only set this or Rel, not both

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Usage
member.summary: The context in which this addess can be used. Local addresses may differ in layout from general addresses, and frequently use local script (as opposed to Latin script) as well, though local script is allowed in general addresses. Unless specified general usage is assumed.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.MailClass
member.summary: Classes of mail accepted at the address. Unless specified both is assumed

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Agent
member.summary: The agent who actually receives the mail. Used in work addresses. Also for 'in care of' or 'c/o'.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Housename
member.summary: Used in places where houses or buildings have names (and not necessarily numbers), eg. "The Pillars".

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Street
member.summary: Can be street, avenue, road, etc. This element also includes the house number and room/apartment/flat/floor number.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Pobox
member.summary: Covers actual P.O. boxes, drawers, locked bags, etc. This is usually but not always mutually exclusive with street.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Neighborhood
member.summary: This is used to disambiguate a street address when a city contains more than one street with the same name, or to specify a small place whose mail is routed through a larger postal town. In China it could be a county or a minor city.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.City
member.summary: Can be city, village, town, borough, etc. This is the postal town and not necessarily the place of residence or place of business.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Subregion
member.summary: Handles administrative districts such as U.S. or U.K. counties that are not used for mail addressing purposes. Subregion is not intended for delivery addresses.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Region
member.summary: A state, province, county (in Ireland), Land (in Germany), departement (in France), etc.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Postcode
member.summary: Postal code. Usually country-wide, but sometimes specific to the city (e.g. "2" in "Dublin 2, Ireland" addresses).

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.Country
member.summary: The name or code of the country.

member.name: P:Google.GData.Extensions.StructuredPostalAddress.FormattedAddress
member.summary: The full, unstructured postal address.
